Field Name: Link to list of reports for the committee
Description: List of all disclosure filings for this committee
Explanation: Link to list of filings made directly by the candidate - mainly statements of candidacy for each election
First character indicates office sought - H=House, S=Senate, P=Presidential. Columns 3-4 are the state abbreviation for Congressional candidates
P=President; S=Senate; H=House
Dem=Democrat
Rep=Republican
full list of Party affiliations

Description: Incumbent or challenger or open seat indicator
Explanation: I=incumbent; C=challenger; O=open seat (where no incumbent sought reelection)
Provided by the candidate on a statement of candidacy
Generally suite number or other secondary address
Note: mailing addresses are not necessarily within the district. Use Candidate Office State and Candidate Office District to specify the location of a campaign

Description: Sum of itemized contributions from individuals
Explanation: Contributions must be itemized (i.e. listing specific information about the donor and the contribution) when the total given to the campaign from a single individual exceeds $200.

Description: Sum of unitemized contributions from individuals
Explanation: Total given to the campaign where specific information about the donors is not required because they have not given more than $200
Sum of the previous two fields (i.e. ind_ite_con and ind_uni_con)
These must be itemized regardless of amount
Mostly contributions from PACs, also includes contributions from other candidates. These also must be itemized regardless of amount
Sum of the previous 4 fields (i.e. ind_con, par_com_con, oth_com_con and can_con)
Candidates may have more than one committee working for their election (including jointfundraising committees). Transfers from others within the set appear here
Often from banks, but must be made in the normal course of business including interest rates and collateral. Loans from individuals are treated as contributions
Sum of the previous 2 fields (i.e. can_loa and oth_loa)
e.g. refund of deposit for phone bank, etc.
Applies only for Presidential candidates receiving public matching funds in the primaries
Applies only for Presidential candidates receiving public matching funds in the primaries
e.g. interest on bank deposits, capital gains, etc.
Sum of all receipt categories
Total of normal operating expenditures. These must also be itemized when payments to a specific vendor exceed $200
Applies only for Presidential candidates receiving public matching funds in the primaries
Applies only for Presidential candidates receiving public matching funds in the primaries
Candidates may have more than one committee working for their election (including jointfundraising committees). Transfers to others within the set appear here

Description: Loan repayments to banks or others

Explanation: Sum of the previous 2 fields (i.e. can_loa_rep and oth_loa_rep)

Description: Contribution refunds made to other committees
Explanation: Mainly PACs or other candidates
Sum of the previous 3 fields (i.e. ind_ref, par_com_ref and oth_com_ref)
e.g. donations to charity, contributions to state or local candidates, etc.
Sum of all disbursement categories

Field Name: Cash on Hand Beginning of Period
Explanation: Cash balance for the campaign at the start of the two-year period

Field Name: Cash on Hand Close of Period
Explanation: Ending cash balance on the most recent filing
Sum of all contributions minus any contribution refunds
Sum of all operating expenditures minus any offsets to those expenditures
Beginning date for the first report during the two year period
Ending date of the most recent report
